meanings.definition: The essential or vital part of something
meanings.sent1: In a plant, water and sunlight are the lifebloods that keep it growing.
meanings.sent2: The lifebloods of a successful business are hard work and customer satisfaction.
meanings.sent3: Without the lifebloods of coffee and breakfast, I can't start my day.
meanings.sent4: Laughter and joy are the lifebloods that keep our spirits alive.
meanings.sent5: Friendship and trust are the lifebloods that strengthen relationships.

meanings.definition: A vital or essential element or factor
meanings.sent1: Education is considered one of the lifebloods for a brighter future.
meanings.sent2: Communication is the lifebloods of a healthy relationship.
meanings.sent3: Music and art are the lifebloods that make life more colorful.
meanings.sent4: Honesty and integrity are the lifebloods of a trustworthy person.
meanings.sent5: Teamwork and collaboration are the lifebloods of a successful project.
